Actively encourage directors, senior managers and others to consult Compliance on initiatives and plans at the outset.
Have or acquire, where possible, good contacts with the regulator and with Compliance Officers from other companies
2. Monitoring/ Review:
Actively monitor the business to provide assurance to all relevant parties including Company management, Group that the processes, procedures and systems in the business are delivering satisfactory standards of compliance, Group Corporate Governance.
Encourage and assist functional department in development its own monitoring process to ensure the compliance with applicable local laws and other requirements from the Group.
Closely liaise with Internal Audit should ensure sufficient and necessary assurance could be delivered on a most effective and efficient manner without unnecessary burden on the business.
3. Reporting:
Submit regular compliance reports to Group Compliance in accordance with the standard format and requirements set by Group Compliance from time to time.
Report major compliance issues and problems to the CEO and Group Compliance on a timely basis in accordance with the policies and requirements set out in the Group Compliance Standards/ Guidelines.
Report to the company's Management Committee/ Risk Management Committee/ Supervisory Committee, advising the Committees of the standards of compliance prevailing in the business, the results of compliance monitoring, problems and weaknesses in the business and the impact which proposed regulations will have on the business.
Submit the regular or ad hoc reports to Local Regulator as per requests.
4. Training & Enhancing Awareness:
Responsible for conducting direct training or assisting and/or providing advice in the development of Company training strategies, policies and materials related to Compliance, Financial Crimes and AML issues.
5. Liaise & Coordinate:
Develop and maintain appropriate relationship or perform certain specific activities with various external/ internal bodies and parties: Risk Management Committee, Risk Managers, local senior management including CEO, Regulators, External Auditors, Group Compliance, Compliance functions of other local subsidiaries
6. Anti-Money Laundering Function (AML):
Responsible for the compliance with the local as well as relevant overseas money laundering and terrorist financing regulations.
Ensure that money laundering and terrorist financing deterrence procedures and controls are robust and in line with the Group.
7. Financial Crime Function:
Ensure clear and practical Financial Crimes related policies and procedures are in place through either directly adopting the Regional policies and procedures or where local regulations or senior management.
Ensure any breach or potential breach to the Anti-Bribery and Corruption (ABC) risk appetite or ABC policy requirements is timely reported to the local senior management and Group.
Ensure the appropriate investigations and follow-up actions are taken in time.
8. Development & Implementation of an Operational Risk Management Program:
Provide Company’s Risk Management Committee update on the on-going risk exposure monitoring (credit, counterparty, liquidity, operational and market risks).
Develops Company’s risk management information requirements, reporting thresholds and monitoring methods for determining priorities.
Ensure business functions and company management in compliance with all internal requirements on risk management.
Review and challenge the incident data, Key Indicators and Risk and Control Assessment are updated based on the implication of internal incident on Departmental Risks, advice if there are any additional incidents that should be reported/ discussed.

title:
[EAI] Automotive Software Project Leader/Manager
- job post
description:
Company Description

The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services. Since the beginning of 2013, its operations have been divided into four business sectors: Automotive Technology, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology.
The Bosch Group comprises Robert Bosch GmbH and its roughly 360 subsidiaries and regional companies in some 50 countries. If its sales and service partners are included, then Bosch is represented in roughly 150 countries. This worldwide development, manufacturing, and sales network is the foundation for further growth.
Bosch Global Software Technologies Company Limited (BGSV) is 100% owned subsidiary of Robert Bosch GmbH - one of the world’s leading global suppliers of technology and services, offering end-to-end Engineering, IT, and Business Solutions.
Starting its operation from 2010 at Etown 2 in HCMC, BGSV is the first software development center of Bosch in Southeast Asia. BGSV nowadays have over 4,000 associates, with a global footprint and presence in the US, Europe, and the Asia Pacific region.
With our unique ability to offer end-to-end solutions that connect sensors, software, and services, we enable businesses to move from the traditional to digital or improve businesses by introducing a digital element in their products and processes.

Job Description

The Automotive industry has always been a sector of fast development. Innovations require complex solutions with complex software functionality. New gadgets and innovative technologies are driving a disruptive change that experts agree will reshape the foundations of the automotive industry as we know it. These advances are directly related to the embedded technology found within the Automotive systems, including micro-controllers, flash memory and analog products.
Automotive Steering already generates around 60 percent of its sales with electric steering systems. A compact, locally developed, and particularly inexpensive steering for cars for Asian markets shows that the company offers more than just solutions for premium vehicles. As a result, customers with lower-cost compact cars also benefit from the product’s advantages. If you're passionate about Automotive Engineering, welcome to our Automotive Steering at BOSCH! The team is responsible for software development & testing for Automotive Steering system. As a SW Project Leader/Manager, you will play a crucial part of team to contribute to these activities, divided into R(esponsible), A(pprover), S(upport), I(nformed) and C(onsultant):
Manage the project and achieve the project goals according to the Project Management Plan (PMP).
Prepare, carry out planning, execute, monitor and control from beginning (kick off/QG0) to end (QG4).
Lead the entire project team, establish planning, control of product cost, project budget and resources.
Provide risk management on project level (monetary evaluation and avoidance, mitigation strategy).
Communicate, escalate, manage crisis with internal or external partners and customers in coordination with customer account.
Report project included but not limited to identification, implementation and escalation of necessary changes on project level.
Optimize project handling and implementation of Automotive Steering Focus Topic results.

Qualifications
B.S or equivalent degree in Mechatronic Engineering, Automotive Engineering, Computing Engineering, Information Technology or related major.
2+ years of experience in leading Embedded Software development project team based on solid project management capability and experience.
Hands-on experience in SW development within the discipline (~2 years)
Acquire practical knowledge of software development life-cycle, project management processes.
Strong leadership experience in cross functional teams, communication and interpersonal skills
Capability to moderate and negotiate
Good at networking and engage connection
English proficiency is a must. Japanese proficiency is a plus
Software development background in Automotive domain is a treasure.

Additional Information

Why BOSCH?
Because we do not just follow trends, we create them. Together we turn ideas into reality, working every day to make the world of tomorrow a better place. Do you have high standards when it comes to your job? So do we. At Bosch, you will discover more than just work.
Benefits and Career Opportunities
Working in one of the Best Places to Work in Vietnam and Top 30 of the Most Innovative Companies all over the world
Join in a dynamic and fast-growing global company (English-speaking environment), with opportunity to work in global projects and being a part of innovation team contributing initiative ideas to the hi-tech world
Onsite opportunities: short-term and long-term assignments in worldwide offices
Engage in our diverse training programs which surely help strengthen both your personal and professionalism
13th-month salary bonus + attractive performance bonus (you'll love it!) + annual performance appraisal
100% offered salary and mandatory social insurances in 2-month probation
15++ days of annual leave + 1-day of birthday leave
Premium health insurance for employee and 02 family members
Flexible working time and working model
Lunch and parking allowance
Good benefits of company activities such as: football, badminton, yoga, Aerobic, team building…

title:
RISK & CONTRACT MANAGER
- job post
description:
Your responsibilities:
You will develop Risk Management competence in Sales teams and execution teams (PMs) by conducting pragmatic training periodically with specific and relevant content, custom-made for the particular business, periodically updating the content to make it relevant and current. You will ensure the portfolio of contracts in the business follows contract and claim management methodologies in accordance with internal standard procedures.
You will drive and manage professional Risk Review process during the tendering phase laying a good foundation for the same during the execution phase by participation in Local/Hub/Group risk review meetings, ensure that group Risk Management directives, instructions, guidelines and governance processes are communicated to all the stakeholders both for the Tender Risk Management and Project Risk Management.
You will actively participate in select Project Reviews and advise the team from a commercial, contractual and risk management perspective leading to Risk and Opportunity Assessment, ensure development and implementation of a risk mitigation and opportunity plan in cooperation with Project Management ensuring margin improvements during project execution and preventing margin erosion.
You will involve in reviewing and sharing comment on commercial and technical tender terms and conditions, develop contract strategy based on Hitachi Energy’s policies, customer requirements, and the overall execution strategy taking into account risk, pricing, scope, and schedule. You will establish and enforce standard change methodologies in the portfolio of contracts to identify change and quantify the additional time and compensation due to Hitachi Energy as per the contract, define approval requirements and communicate change to the customer.
You will enforce and defend Hitachi Energy's contractual interests against customers and suppliers during the whole of the project life cycle including monitoring and assessment of changes and deviations, as well as defending and enforcing claims. In concert with Legal, develops the negotiation strategy and supports negotiations, support Legal handling of formal dispute resolution, litigation and arbitration and notify and liaises with Legal to report major claims and keeps Legal updated of any critical development during project execution.
You will support drafting of Purchase Orders, Contracts and Subcontracts and ensures that relevant (sub) contracts contain appropriate contract terms to protect Hitachi Energy’s interest, including flow-down of main contract terms. Analyzes prime contract terms to highlight areas of potential opportunity and risk, such as ambiguities, omissions and conflicts, as work proceeds. You will seek advice from Legal to draft, negotiate and finalize agreements during the Sales and Project Execution phases and develop.
You will provide guidance and leadership on contract management-related matters to cross-department business team members, participate in claim negotiations and provide professional support where required regarding purchasing activities ensuring flow down of customer terms and conditions to the sub-vendors.
Living Hitachi Energy's core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.
Your background:
Bachelor/master’s degree in law or business Administration/ Engineering with a law degree.
Minimum 5 to 7 years of working experience in one of the following functions: Risk Management/ Contract Management/ Legal/ Commercial Role.
Complex project execution experience throughout the contract lifecycle, proven track record of handling projects of varying size and complexity.
Experience in drafting different types of contracts viz. supply contracts, service contracts, Sub-supplier, Internal Consortium, External Consortium, Inter/Intragroup Contracts, Internal Consortium; High-level Negotiations; Contract Administration, Claims, Change Management and sound knowledge of planning and scheduling.
Knowledge of the HITACHI Risk & Project Review process, risk management principles, company guidelines and instructions.
Risk Management Certification of international repute; preferable but not mandatory
Ability to resolve conflicts/disputes and manage dispute resolution in cooperation with the Legal department. Understanding of project planning analysis as well as business acumen, integrity, result-oriented approach and problem-solving skills.
Site-based experience and technical knowledge of transformers and associated electrical products is an added advantage.
Advanced communication skills to collaborate with the global team and Business Leadership Team.
High-level organization skills with attention to detail and strong process orientation.
Demonstrated experience in Contract Management.
Proficiency in English both written and spoken. Excellent command of legal terminology.

About the Country Specification Manager Role:
An exciting opportunity awaits you as a Country Specification Manager with our prestigious multinational organisation. In this strategic role, you will play a pivotal part in driving our brand's influence by overseeing the specification process within the designated country. Your role encompasses not only deepening relationships with key stakeholders but also aligning our products and solutions with the unique requirements of each project.
Key Responsibilities:
Identifying and engaging potential clients and influential decision-makers across the industry, devising comprehensive strategies to effectively establish our presence within target accounts
Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to align our products and solutions as the preferred choice for diverse projects, ensuring each offering is tailored to meet the specific demands of the market
Cultivating enduring relationships with pivotal figures in the industry, such as architects, specifiers, consultants, contractors, and developers
Vigilantly monitoring upcoming projects and proactively identifying opportunities where our offerings can be specified
Coordinating internally to prepare and deliver compelling bids, proposals, and product information that secure project specifications
Conducting thorough research and analysis to unearth industry trends, opportunities, and potential challenges
Delivering imperatively presentations to architects, specifiers, and decision-makers, effectively showcasing the exceptional attributes of our products and solutions
Staying attuned to the latest advancements within the industry and our product range
Leading training sessions for internal teams, external partners, and clients to enhance product knowledge and application expertise
Setting ambitious sales targets and meticulously tracking performance against these objectives
Providing regular comprehensive reports to the sales leadership team, detailing progress, challenges, and advancements
Collaborating seamlessly with various departments, including marketing, product development, and customer service, to ensure a seamless customer experience
To succeed in this role, you must have good communication skills in English.
Key Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Architecture, or a related field
Proven track record in specification and solution sales within the industry, accompanied by a robust network of connections to key industry players
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in nurturing and sustaining professional relationships with industry decision-makers
Strong analytical capabilities to assess market trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences
Collaborative mindset for effective cross-functional teamwork
Willingness to travel frequently for client engagements and industry events
This multinational company stands as a global leader in its specialised field, renowned for its commitment to excellence and continuous development of its workforce.
If you possess unwavering determination, a strategic mindset, and a desire to propel your career to new heights, the role of Country Specification Manager offers an exceptional platform. Expect significant opportunities for career advancement tailored to individuals who resonate with this dynamic role.
Apply today.

title:
Senior Copywriter
- job post
description:
A, GENERAL DESCRIPTION

CREATORY is not a traditional agency. We are always on the next wave of the digital age. From the root of successful influencer marketing, we expand our capacity to provide total solutions for brands including IP management & development, content solution, community building, brand social channel, IMC plan, virtual production. Especially with technology based and pivoting to the future, we navigate to web3 by providing total solutions which promote blockchain-based brands/products or services. We cherish our entrepreneurial spirit and embrace the opportunity to rethink media & content to get out of agency definition.

We are working for several local and international clients incl. LG, CJ, Orion, Mirae, NH Securities, Likelion,... Not just working as a service provider, we play as strategic partners to brands. We are growing fast and we know that our success is a direct result of our talents.

We would like to find someone who can embrace this chance as a part of our established planning team. While looking for a Senior (Advertising) Copywriter, we hope to find someone who doesn’t mind challenging their creativity for diversified projects that range from web2 traditional brands to web3 brands (p2e, NFT, …)

Either it is developing a creative concept for the whole proposal or crafting an engaging advertising post/video, we hope you can nail it with the mindset of a game changer.

B, MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Planning
Meeting with the account team to clearly get the client's brief and discuss to clarify their requirements
Familiarising with the product/service, target audience and competitors' marketing activities in the market.
Meeting with other members of the planning team (planners, strategy lead,...) to discuss and firm the strategic directions
Come up with creative strategy which solve client's requirement and match both audience insight the social media trends
Brainstorm big ideas and concepts to embody the communication strategy
Maximise the use of Creatory’s available resources (such as: KOLs, virtual KOLs, virtual production, communities, etc.) to leverage creative communication strategy for clients
Leverage digital platforms such as Tiktok, Youtube, Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, Discord,etc… to stretch brand message
Deploy creative execution ideas or content angles which are in-line with the campaign big ideas/concept
Write clear, persuasive, original copy to demonstrate our ideas
Join pitching with persuasive storytelling
Modify plan based on client's feedback and request in planning phase
Adjust execution plan to adapt the market trends or reality if necessary in execution phase
Coordinate and quality check the proposals from freelance planner if any

2. Execution
Develop detailed script for the campaign (Viral video, tiktok challenges, KOL review videos outline, KOL live stream content outline, branded social post...)
Utilise different language styles and tones that both represent various brand voices and appeal to various target audiences.
Responsible for constant detailed revision and rewriting the copy either at the request of the client or to tune up the communication for maximising views and engagement.
Join the assessment of KOL choice to deliver properly the right mood and tone of the campaign
Debrief creative ideas for production team to bring the ideas to life
Follow up production phase (Video/photo shooting, video production,...) and give feedbacks to make sure the campaign execution ideas are produced and carried out smoothly
Quality check the copy that is generated by team members or freelance copywriters and offer feedback when necessary.
Quality check the KOLs' outline scripts to make sure they convey the right message

3. Others
Conduct research and gather knowledge from creative course to build and develop creative team
Research insights from different target audiences for further effective planning
Support internal teams to generate creative ideas to conduct internal activities
Other tasks assigned by the line manager.

C, REQUIREMENT:

Qualification:
Competence in spoken and written English communication.
The advantage for College or Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Filming, Communication or Journalism.
+ 2 years of experience in a similar position in marketing, advertising, creative production or commercial film industry.
Experiences in commercial video projects such as Youtube video, viral video, commercial film/video ads, KOL videos, Comedy Drama Film, and Video content, Social content, …
Open or interest in getting to know blockchain and its related terms such as: p2e, NFT, metaverse,....
Skills
Ability to write concise, compelling copy and handle multiple projects.
Excellent attention to detail.
Energy, stamina, and the ability to work under pressure.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
High levels of creativity, imagination, initiative and enthusiasm.
Interest in commerce, popular culture, and new advertising trends and techniques.
Possess good leadership, people and project management skills.
Work within strict budgets.
Understand the different language styles that appeal to various target markets.
Experience in research or interest in Web3, Blockchain, and Crypto is a bonus.

D, WHY CREATORY
Amazing Teammates
"Recruiting the smartest, most talented and most innovative people in Vietnam" has been our consistent talent strategy since the beginning. With that said, we bring you an outstanding team of colleagues who can help you take your life to the next level.
The growing and trendsetting advertising agency in a metaverse workplace.
Work with new types of global clients and projects: Virtual, Communities, and blockchain-based products/services,...
A World-Class Company Culture
+ Dare to dream big
+ Evolve through learning
+ Positive and passionate
+ Practice transparency and candour
+ Turn customers into raving fans
+ Help others rock their greatest lives
+ Honour my words with action.

A Flexible, Dynamic and Full-equipped Working Environment where Creatorians can blast the fun in work, break the old boxes with creativity and be ready for the transformation.
+ Hybrid working policy
+ 13th-month salary (Depends on the business results and company situation)
+ Career conversation and growing opportunities with promotion program

+ Company Device

+ Learning & Development opportunities.
+ Team outing & bonding activities

+ Additional benefit (annual leaves, annual health check, special insurance, ...)

E, ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Recruitment Process
1/ 10 - Minute Phone Screening: (Only qualified candidates will be contacted by HR team. Thanks for understanding)
2/ 1 round Interview (Onsite) with Creative Planning Lead & Client Solution Manager

Office: 65 - 67 Doan Nhu Hai, W12, D4, HCMC
Working hour: 10:00 - 19:00, Monday - Friday
Visit us on: https://www.creatory.vn/ & https://www.facebook.com/creatorydailylife

title:

description:
Job Description
2023 will potentially see Sandoz become a standalone organization! Already a global market leader in Generics and Biosimilar medicine, this is an exciting, once-in-a-career opportunity to set our own path forward as an independent, purpose-driven organization, and as the founders of a new Sandoz, this is a time of immense opportunity for us all, both professionally and personally!

Together we will shape the future of Sandoz… are you ready to make a difference?

As a Key Account Manager, you will take ownerships for achieving or exceeding key account goals for assigned products within the allocated geography through the achievement of related quantitative and qualitative key performance indicators and ensuring compliance with company and industry standards.

Your Responsibilities:

Achieve KAM business goals in the assigned territory by:
Demonstrate superior account engagement skills and cross-functional collaboration, with a deep understanding of the healthcare system and key accounts.
Analyze the key account landscape and identify/segment target key accounts. This includes understanding the key accounts in the assigned geography, their stakeholders (HCPs, Health Authority, Pharmacies, Formulary, Purchasing committee...) and the tiering, prioritizing, and clustering process used to select key accounts.
Develop and manage key account plans, supervise their progress, and take corrective actions to ensure that key account business objectives are met.
Ensuring tender listing, availability of products, tender performance, RX fill rate, and new growth opportunities.
Apply CRM system Scout and standard reports to maintain a correct and complete customer database, ensure high quality inputs, and improve account engagement.
Adhere to all local regulations, industry standards, and company Code of Conduct, including interactions with healthcare professionals, compliance, and Pharmacovigilance.
Provide regular reports on key account activities and performance, including status updates, insights, and recommendations.
Assist Market Assess Manager to coach for Key Account Executives to develop excellent account engagement skills aligned to KPI KAM and KAM model by applying hybrid coaching, including planning, creating, conducting, and completing coaching sessions
Perform other tasks assigned by the Hiring manager / handle other assignments as requested within given timeline.

description:

A strong sense of urgency and the ability to jump on client requests as they come up.

A "ready and willing" attitude when it comes to travel.
A resilient mindset, ability to work under pressure, and focus on successful outcomes.

Previous experience in payment solutions.
Exposure to an industry or business that runs 24/7.

Run established stand-ups and cadences with your team; ensure that tasks are prioritized according to the level of importance and/or urgency and closed off correctly.

Your mission is to build and grow your recruitment team to support our clients with their hiring needs and deliver a good experience. As the Recruitment Team Lead/Manager, you have to lead by example and coach your junior consultants to be experts in their field.
What You’ll Be Doing
Managing a team of Recruitment Consultants in achieving individual KPIs and delivering suitable talents that match clients' hiring needs
Growing the business by establishing a relationship with a potential client and transforming it into a business deal
Understanding clients’ company profiles and hiring needs including the opening position and requirements
Managing ongoing recruitment process of clients' company and guiding the team in handling any potential blockers
Ensuring Recruitment Consultants' personal growth through assistance and training while working with Team Leader to scale up the team's business growth
Why You Should Join Us
Key strategic role and contributor: You will have the chance to be part of the core Vietnam Commercial team, involved in the strategic growth and direction of the company
Freedom: You are joining a very young team where you will be given lots of freedom and trust to build the team as you deem fit.
Who We Are Looking For
At least 2 years of leadership experience in managing a sales or recruitment team
At least 3 years of experience in Business Development, Account Management, or Recruitment fields
A solid background or understanding of the Manufacturing/Technology industry is a strong plus
Ability to handle clients' objections and close business deals
Strong communication skills in English
Results and target-oriented proven by past work achievement
Hungry to learn something new out of your expertise but also driven to be a self-starter
Adaptable and comfortable with the fast-paced work, changes, and uncertainties of a startup environment

Let’s Realise Human Potential.

At Glints, we are building the #1 tech-enabled recruitment and career discovery platform in Southeast Asia that helps people and organizations realize their human potential.

We have impacted many lives but there’s still plenty to be done. If you’re ready to grow and make an impact, you’ve come to the right place.

What is Glints?

Glints is the leading talent ecosystem in Southeast Asia, with an enduring purpose of contributing to a world where people and organizations can realize their human potential.

Today, Glints is the most well-funded and well-capitalized startup in the talent recruitment space in Southeast Asia, with over US$80M in total investments raised till date.

Our tech-enabled approach to recruitment and career discovery connects more than 4 million candidates to their next dream opportunities. We have also supported more than 50,000 companies in finding top talent and doubling recruitment efficiency.

Our agility and firm hold on our core purpose and values have allowed us to remain resilient and thrive through tumultuous times.

In 2020, we were recognized by LinkedIn as one of the Top 10 Startups in Singapore. In 2022, we were featured in the top 20 of Nikkei-FT-Statista High-Growth Companies Asia-Pacific 2021 list. Moreover, we were also featured in the top 10 fastest-growing companies in Singapore by The Straits Times.

Who We Are

At Glints, personal and professional growth are just as important as business growth. That's why we created the Glints Culture Code: #RIIBCOH. It defines our values, guides our decisions and actions, and is what makes us special.

Relentlessly Resourceful: Whatever it takes, just make it happen (ethically)
Integrity: Have courage, be guided by the truth, don’t be afraid
Impact: Missionaries, not mercenaries
Beginners’ Mindset: Stay humble, don’t be attached to ego
Customer Obsessed: Customers First
Ownership: Care intensely about the mission and take responsibility
High Standards: Dream big and deliver epic outcomes fast

Where We Work

Since Glints was officially launched in Singapore in 2015, we've rapidly grown our footprint across Greater Southeast Asia to operate in Indonesia, Singapore, Vietnam, Taiwan, Malaysia and Philippines.

Learn more about Glints and our culture at bit.ly/glintsculture,
Or check out our Careers Page at https://glints.com/careers !

title:
Recruitment Team Lead/Manager (Technology)
- job post
description:
At Glints, we are building the #1 tech-enabled recruitment and career discovery platform in Southeast Asia that helps people and organisations realise their human potential by joining great organisations, learning the right skills and building great teams.

About The Role

Your mission is to build and grow your recruitment team to support our clients with their hiring needs and deliver a good experience. As the Recruitment Team Lead/Manager, you have to lead by example and coach your junior consultants to be experts in their field.
What You’ll Be Doing
Managing a team of Recruitment Consultants in achieving individual KPIs and delivering suitable talents that match clients' hiring needs
Growing the business by establishing a relationship with a potential client and transforming it into a business deal
Understanding clients’ company profiles and hiring needs including the opening position and requirements
Managing ongoing recruitment process of clients' company and guiding the team in handling any potential blockers
Ensuring Recruitment Consultants' personal growth through assistance and training while working with Team Leader to scale up the team's business growth
Why You Should Join Us
Key strategic role and contributor: You will have the chance to be part of the core Vietnam Commercial team, involved in the strategic growth and direction of the company
Freedom: You are joining a very young team where you will be given lots of freedom and trust to build the team as you deem fit
Who We Are Looking For
At least 3 years of experience in Business Development, Account Management, or Recruitment fields
A solid background or understanding of Technology is a strong plus
Ability to handle clients' objections and close business deals
Strong communication skills in English
Results and target-oriented proven by past work achievement
Hungry to learn something new out of your expertise but also driven to be a self-starter
Adaptable and comfortable with the fast-paced work, changes, and uncertainties of a startup environment

Let’s Realise Human Potential.

At Glints, we are building the #1 tech-enabled recruitment and career discovery platform in Southeast Asia that helps people and organizations realize their human potential.

We have impacted many lives but there’s still plenty to be done. If you’re ready to grow and make an impact, you’ve come to the right place.

What is Glints?

Glints is the leading talent ecosystem in Southeast Asia, with an enduring purpose of contributing to a world where people and organizations can realize their human potential.

Today, Glints is the most well-funded and well-capitalized startup in the talent recruitment space in Southeast Asia, with over US$80M in total investments raised till date.

Our tech-enabled approach to recruitment and career discovery connects more than 4 million candidates to their next dream opportunities. We have also supported more than 50,000 companies in finding top talent and doubling recruitment efficiency.

Our agility and firm hold on our core purpose and values have allowed us to remain resilient and thrive through tumultuous times.

In 2020, we were recognized by LinkedIn as one of the Top 10 Startups in Singapore. In 2022, we were featured in the top 20 of Nikkei-FT-Statista High-Growth Companies Asia-Pacific 2021 list. Moreover, we were also featured in the top 10 fastest-growing companies in Singapore by The Straits Times.

Who We Are

At Glints, personal and professional growth are just as important as business growth. That's why we created the Glints Culture Code: #RIIBCOH. It defines our values, guides our decisions and actions, and is what makes us special.

Relentlessly Resourceful: Whatever it takes, just make it happen (ethically)
Integrity: Have courage, be guided by the truth, don’t be afraid
Impact: Missionaries, not mercenaries
Beginners’ Mindset: Stay humble, don’t be attached to ego
Customer Obsessed: Customers First
Ownership: Care intensely about the mission and take responsibility
High Standards: Dream big and deliver epic outcomes fast

Where We Work

Since Glints was officially launched in Singapore in 2015, we've rapidly grown our footprint across Greater Southeast Asia to operate in Indonesia, Singapore, Vietnam, Taiwan, Malaysia and Philippines.

Learn more about Glints and our culture at bit.ly/glintsculture,
Or check out our Careers Page at https://glints.com/careers !

title:
TikTok Shop Graduate Development Program (Vietnam E-commerce) - 2024 Start
- job post
description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The e-commerce industry has seen tremendous growth in recent years and has become a hotly contested space amongst leading Internet companies, and its future growth cannot be underestimated.

With millions of loyal users globally, we believe TikTok is an ideal platform to deliver a brand new and better e-commerce experience to our users. We are looking for passionate and talented people to join our product and operations team, together we can build an e-commerce ecosystem that is innovative, secure and intuitive for our users.

We are looking for talented individuals to join us in 2024. As a graduate, you will get unparalleled opportunities for you to kickstart your career, pursue bold ideas and explore limitless growth opportunities. Co-create a future driven by your inspiration with TikTok.

Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to TikTok and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis - we encourage you to apply early.

TikTok Shop Graduate Development Program
TikTok Shop Graduate Development Program is a 24-month long graduate trainee program, aimed at developing budding talents to be well-versed with the e-commerce world. The program consists of multiple job rotations where you will experience and learn about the different roles in our e-commerce team. Engage and empower sellers, participate in running campaigns, build strong networks with leading brands and creators, and more! Join us today for an exciting opportunity to be part of our pioneering group of TikTok Shop graduate trainees!

Program Journey
1. Seller Acquisition - Acquire and help sellers of small and medium enterprises to have a smooth onboarding experience on TikTok Shop and deliver the best customer experience.
2. Seller Incubation - Improve our seller's growth and performance through knowledge transfer, training, progress tracking, and empower sellers to become successful on the platform.
3. Account Management - Progress to work with bigger brands in the market and manage more complex services to improve growth and performance of our brands.
4. Campaign Management - Keep our communities engaged and achieve maximum sales through our various TikTok Shop marketing campaigns that are happening all year round.
5. Integrated Marketing - Work with our marketing team to build awareness of TikTok Shop and create mega campaigns which will impact the whole platform.
6. Shopping Center - Ensure the new Shopping Center feature runs smoothly and generates revenues with efficient product assortment.
7. Top Creators and Long-tail Creators - Coordinate and work with our creators to help them be successful as they grow together with TikTok Shop.
8. Multi-channel Networks and TikTok Shop Partners - Become a TikTok Shop relationship manager for our multi-channel networks and TikTok Shop partners. Ensure there is a win-win relationship for our client's brands and our company.

And/or other tasks assigned to you by the company.

Perks and Benefits
Competitive salary and benefits
Intensive training program to assist in each rotation track
Strong learning opportunities from peers
Chance to lead and be a part of high impact projects
Diverse work environment
Possibility of an international assignment
Opportunity to grow and be our future leaders
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in any field with maximum 1 year full-time work experience
Intellectual curiosity and adept at learning new concepts and skills
Self-motivated to push through and ensure project success
Excellent interpersonal skills
English proficiency
Selection Process
1. Assessment
2. Interview with HR
3. Interview with managers
4. Case study presentation to leaders
5. Interview with leaders
6. Onboard in Jun-Jul 2024

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.
If you have any questions, please reach out to us at apac-earlycareers@tiktok.com.

title:
Product Design Manager (Vietnam)
- job post
description:
Join Axon and be a Force for Good.
At Axon, we're on a mission to Protect Life. We're explorers, pursuing society's most critical safety and justice issues with our ecosystem of devices and cloud software. Like our products, we work better together. We connect with candor and care, seeking out diverse perspectives from our customers, communities and each other.

Life at Axon is fast-paced, challenging and meaningful. Here, you'll take ownership and drive real change. Constantly grow as you work hard for a mission that matters at a company where you matter.
Your Impact
Our Digital Evidence Management System (DEMS) team is solving difficult cloud and local storage challenges. Axon manages massive amounts of digital files – tens of petabytes from thousands of first responders worldwide. The DEMS team works on improving workflows for the ingestion, playback, management & access control, searching, and sharing of case related files, increasing efficiency within the justice system. If you're looking for ownership and autonomy while collaborating across product teams, this role is for you.

Our Team

We believe that happy teams take good care of their customers, so we foster a friendly, open, introspective team culture that encourages everyone to speak their mind and deliberately avoid red tape, unnecessary rituals, politics, and jerks. We focus on productivity, and try to avoid having senseless meetings or processes, while we emphasize planning to keep our work-life balance healthy and sustainable.

We can only succeed if we deeply understand our customers and get to know them personally. We spend time with law enforcement officers to learn about their needs, watch their experience and see the real impact of our work. Your first ride-along with a patrol officer will forever change your perception of first responders and their role in society.
What You'll Do
Location: Ho Chi Minh City or Remote
Reports to: Director of Product Design, Axon Evidence
Direct Reports: 2-3 product designers initially

Manage a team of 2-3 product designers and own parts of the cases & sharing experience across the DEMS organization and collaborate on cross product strategy for Axon-wide cases & sharing workflows.
You'll have ownership of the full design process, from partnering with product managers on initial research and discovery through concepting, detailed design, testing, and ongoing design iteration.
Collaborate with product managers and researchers in field research with domestic and international law enforcement agencies and help transform that research into practical, scalable solutions using a variety of research methods: observational, interviews, participatory, usability testing, competitive analysis, etc.
Produce artifacts that define and communicate your solutions. It will be up to you, but we generally use a combination of journey maps, architecture diagrams, wireframes, final designs, interaction diagrams, and prototypes.
Communicate your solutions within the team and across the organization to gain buy-in and support through building alignment and articulating your vision through strong storytelling and presentations skills. You will present product and feature design proposals up to the executive level.
Collaborate with feature and product teams to think in terms of broad platform and systems strategy to ensure consistent user experiences for our customers across all products.
Work closely with business, product and engineering stakeholders.
Research design trends, customer behavior, competition and current technologies to inform the work you are doing.
Contribute to defining global design patterns, vision, and processes for Axon products.
Be an ambassador, mentor other designers and a champion for the design culture at Axon.
What You Bring
6+ years of product design experience with 2+ years of leading major product design initiatives in medium to high complexity and 2+ years of people management of at least 2 direct reports.
4+ years experience researching, designing and shipping complete web applications with a moderate to high level of complexity (enterprise or complex consumer workflows rather than simple consumer flows).
A degree in HCI, Human Factors, Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Industrial Design, or other related field. A Master's degree is considered a plus.
Strong conceptual & visual design skills and proven ability in rapidly prototyping and designing to communicate ideas to others.
You have a proven track record of applying user-centered design processes and methodology to product definition, design, and development. You have extensive experience with every stage of the design process, including: sketches, wireframes, high fidelity mock-ups, prototyping, and usability testing.
You enjoy collaborating on early product definition as much as you enjoy working with the larger product and engineering teams on implementation.
You have experience with designing for multiple form factors (web, mobile, on-device) and/or modalities (touch, voice, keyboard/mouse).
You excel in written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly explain your ideas and decisions in a way that anyone can understand.
You are highly knowledgeable of the latest design tools and proficient at quickly learning new ones. We currently use Figma for our Product Design work and to house our Design System, but are always evaluating new tools.
You are able to function both independently and in a collaborative team environment.
You have a great portfolio showing both design and research work available for review.


Additional Materials:

Learn more about Axon Evidence here: https://vimeo.com/427422866
Check out our future vision for Axon products here: https://vimeo.com/333871354
Check out our future vision for our records product here: https://vimeo.com/221924983
Read about our ethics board: https://www.axon.com/eeac
Read about our team values: https://global.axon.com/company/values

Benefits that Benefit You
Medical and Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
Robust Paid Time Off policy
Bonuses
Lunch allowance
Cell phone stipend
Free LinkedIn Learning account
Access to 24/7 online emotional and mental support
Gym membership
Free parking
Stocked fridges and pantries - free coffee, cold beverages, snacks
Annual Company Outing Trip
Monthly team social activities
Don't meet every single requirement? That's ok. At Axon, we Aim Far. We think big with a long-term view because we want to reinvent the world to be a safer, better place. We are also committed to building diverse teams that reflect the communities we serve.

Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they check every box in the job description. If you're excited about this role and our mission to Protect Life but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification listed here, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Important Notes
The above job description is not intended as, nor should it be construed as, exhaustive of all duties, responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with this job. The job description may change or be supplemented at any time in accordance with business needs and conditions.
Some roles may also require legal eligibility to work in a firearms environment.
Axon's mission is to Protect Life and is committed to the well-being and safety of its employees as well as Axon's impact on the environment. All Axon employees must be aware of and committed to the appropriate environmental, health, and safety regulations, policies, and procedures. Axon employees are empowered to report safety concerns as they arise and activities potentially impacting the environment.
We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes justice, advances equity, values diversity and fosters inclusion. The vast amount of learning resources (Pluralsight, Pragpub, Leanpub, (e-)books, etc.) and yearly education allowance to step up your game.

MacBook, large screens, and any accessory to let you work comfortably.

Company outing every year.
And many more perks!
Professional Android development experience.
Experience in Kotlin is a must. Experience in Flutter is a big plus.
Experience in writing automated tests for mobile applications.
Enjoy working on challenging solutions and systems.
Believe that building great applications is not only about delivering code that “works”, but involves thinking about reusability, maintainability, security, and performance.
A "Can do attitude" and a product mindset.
Confidence in communicating in English.

Job Title: Digital Designer
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT THE ROLE:
OLIVER is looking to recruit a Digital Designer to work with one of our key clients in Vietnam. As the Designer, you will have a strong integrated design background, with a deep knowledge of digital first advertising and creative.
Experience with After Affects or basic animation and video editing is a must.
You will work on projects involving the ideation of creative digital concepts, and design to the client's brief and exacting standards whilst positively influencing clients with your creative input in addition to undertaking and pitching new creative concepts.
You need to have solid experience and understanding of content on ecommerce platforms like Shoppee and Lazada, designing brand and product toolkits, social media platforms like Facebook, art-working and offline design collateral.
This is a hybrid role – the designer will be working remotely for the most and atleast twice a week from the client office.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
Responsible for brand consistency across all outputs. Experience in ecommerce, digital and offline is desired.
Producing short-form mobile first innovative digital content for the client's websites, digital applications and social media channels
Ability to work independently from creative concept to execution
Work actively with all internal and external stakeholders to ensure the delivery of the highest level of client service – from brief, creative, design and production
To assist the Senior Account Manager in pitching creative solutions in response to marketing strategies
To manage the preparation of all finished artwork files that will comply with the correct output specifications
To ensure all design work adheres to the best practises of ecommerce, digital and social trends and requirements
Managing projects deliverables and key deadlines
Quality control
Client relations, alternative point of contact on-site, supporting the Senior Account Manager in the day to day relationships with key stakeholder
Creative and quality oversight for work produced locally.
Work with key clients to deliver the following types of projects:
E-Commerce specific content like banners and Product Detail Pages for Shoppee, Lazada
On-site design updates (mostly posters, icons, logos and presentation slides)
Support on visual identity and tone of voice for campaign materials including toolkits, POS and OOH
Merchandise design and production
Support on one-off projects (eg brand day, anniversaries, social activities)
Constant and pro-active branded assets optimisation throughout the company
WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO BE GREAT IN THIS ROLE:
Minimum 4+ years of experience in a top digital marketing or advertising agency.
To be self-motivated, working with little supervision, communicating clearly with a line manager about own development needs.
A thorough understanding of the design language and needs inherent to designing for a leading domestic appliance brand
Good client engagement skills with the ability to proactively organize and lead discussions with clients and build strong and effective working relationships with brand managers
The ability to manage and filter workflow and prioritise workloads to maximise productivity with given timeline
Ability to take and challenge a client's brief for clarity
Some exposure and knowledge of working directly with clients without account management support
Creative ability with strong adobe CS (InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop)
Good in After Effects or basic animation and video editing
A good multitasker
Guardian of the client's brand guidelines, constantly challenging and developing them
Working knowledge of digital design and its requirements is a benefit

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT US:
OLIVER provides clients with dedicated agencies. We do this because we believe the traditional agency model is not fit for the speed of modern marketing. Businesses want, and rightly demand, the same quality of strategic and creative thinking the traditional agency provides, but at a speed that befits how they now work.
The traditional agency outside-in model means that huge quantities of time are wasted in the back and forth and linear processes between agencies and clients. OLIVER agencies come to the client, live inside their office and solve their problems collaboratively.
OLIVER agencies are strategic and creative, whilst being agile and adaptive. They cover the full range of integrated marketing, but at the speed that businesses now demand. We allow our clients to work in real time. Creating better work, at pace.

OUR VALUES AND HOW TO LIVE THEM:
Ambition – you look for opportunities to deliver greater value to those around you.
Imagination – you identify a range of solutions to problems.
Inclusion – to be actively pro-inclusive and anti-racist across our community, clients and creations.
Inspiration – you lead by example and encourage others to do the same.
Learning – you have excellent listening skills that helps you to learn from our clients and those around you.
Results – you accept responsibility for your actions.
We've set ambitious, market-leading environmental and social goals around sustainability at OLIVER. We have committed to be net zero by 2030 and take far reaching action on DE&I in the sector. We expect everyone to contribute to our mission, embedding sustainability into every department and through every stage of the project lifecycle.
Inside Ideas Group and its' affiliates are equal opportunity employers committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All [suitable] applicants shall be considered for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local laws.

The Program Manager is responsible to expand orders and revenues including strategy development, new vertical development, opportunities identification deal execution & portfolio management… for GE Haiphong in Energy industry global market including Power, Wind, Grids, Solar, Hydro, Hybrid…
The Business Development & Sales Manager explores additional opportunities for the GE Haiphong portfolio; develop new customer as well as maintaining existent customer relationship and have responsibility for the profitable growth through increasing sales.

As Program he/she will:
Explore additional opportunities for the GE Haiphong portfolio; formulate deal structure, proposal strategy and lead customer negotiations; identify new opportunities with functional partners to develop new products and services for business growth.
Effectively engage with the relevant internal GE businesses as well as external organizations in the market.
Provide deep understanding of global/region energy market, industry dynamics, competitive intelligence, and key customer insights to business leader.
Develop new customer as well as maintain existent customer relationship and coordinate with business support and central functions to showcase GE Haiphong capability and technology, identify and influence key products and technical solutions for the customers.

Bachelor’s degree in engineering or business from an accredited university
Minimum of 5 additional years of professional experience in Technical Sales or Account management or Business Development. Experience in Power, Renewable Energy business or Energy industry will be a plus, i.e. Commercial Operations, Application Engineering, Field Service.

Proven track record of sales result and sales leadership results.
Customer-centric mindset; able to translate customer issues/needs into profitable business solutions.
Outstanding presentation, negotiation, and global communication skills
Strong leadership skills.

Ability to influence cross functional Business teams to drive sales strategy and growth.
Be able to understand and discuss with Customers as well as the Financing community the intricacies of project finance.
Clear and strategic thinker; can simplify complexity to add value.
Enjoys challenges and sees opportunities in adversity.
Passion for customer success, demonstrated collaboration skills with co-creation of new customer-oriented solution to meet customer needs.
Understand Customer business models and leverage solutions to create customer competitive advantage.
Ability to work independently. Strong problem-solving skills
Master’s degree in business (MBA) from an accredited university
Technical Sales Program Graduate (TSLP, CLP, or ECLP)
Flexible travel schedule.
Additional Information
Relocation Assistance Provided: No

title:

- job post
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES
Strategic
Develop and drive the GC Vietnam’s business plan, including originating new revenues and/or new customer on-boarding with GCIB APAC framework.
Building a sustainable business model, revenue streams and customer base in align to the bank’s direction/vision.
Understand the competitive landscape to review and reshape the department’s structure/operations to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Develop marketing strategies, action plans, and business promotion campaign to increase the bank’s revenues, cross-selling ratio and wallet/market share.
Lead and support the RM team to proactively develop customer relationship, anticipate/ manage customer’s expectation and provide effective solutions to achieve highest level of customer’s satisfaction.
Financial
Responsible to meet all of GC Vietnam’s BSC KPI targets (incl. financial targets and management targets, such deposit funding ratio or cross-selling ratio) by GCIB APAC and fulfil Bank management’s expectations in driving the bank’s initiatives/ campaigns/projects.
Responsible to track progress and results.
Customer
Ensure effective internal and external communication, ie within department and inter-department, plus externally with customers and/or external stakeholders.
Oversee the entire credit assessment of the department including bank facilities applications, review & renewals, timely monitoring and other relevant evaluation processes.
Ensure timely delivery and accuracy of banking facilities, credit assessment, analysis and evaluation.
Establish effective collaboration with product offices, regional HQ, overseas office in conducting business promotion & cross-selling.
Supervise the negotiation process between deal team members and customers to achieve highest level of efficiency, effectiveness and customer’s satisfaction.
Lead and support team to build long-term banking relationships with key customers to develop new business and to deliver extraordinary customer experiences.
Anticipate as well as be sensitive to shifting customer expectations and guide the team to consider appropriate measures to ensure the Bank stays ahead of competitors.
Develop and maintain strong stakeholder management with key stakeholders both within MUFG and externally.
Work in partnership with colleagues within the branch to deliver an integrated service for our customers, as well as to share knowledge and best practices on own area of expertise.
Work in partnership with other GCIB relationship managers across our global network for large cross border deals to understand the customer’s business strategy, financial needs, product proposals and provide input to key customer sales pitches.
Work in partnership with colleagues in Head Office and Regional Office to discuss complex deals and seek commercial solutions for the customer.
Work in partnership with Credit on any credit issues associated with the deal.
Work in partnership with Product Offices from MUFG and MUFG entities including but not limited to Vietin Bank (and Morgan Stanley) to leverage our network capabilities and products/expertise for deals as well as to maintain relationship for future business opportunities.
Visit clients as often as required, to represent the Bank to resolve issues and to maintain customer relationships.
People
Responsible for managing (objective setting & performance management), developing (coaching, career progression & training) and rewarding (financial and non-financial reward decisions) for Direct Reports.
Act as a role model to team members and adhere to all company policies / guidelines.
Support, coach and guide team on complex Corporate Banking issues.
Provide appropriate guidance and advise to subordinate in terms of work, business and career advancement.
Support, coach and guide the team on complex GCIB issues.
Other/Control
Support team by leading the meeting or presentation to senior level customers.
Review all deal proposals and credit applications if necessary to ensure pricing, product offerings and the structuring of the deal is aligned to business strategy, delivers a high quality of service to customers and mitigates risk for the Bank.
Review presentation materials for pitches prepared by the team and provide input.
Support team by leading difficult negotiations with customers including but not limited to contract terms and conditions and pricing, as well as seek commercial solutions to finalise the deal.
Lead and support initiatives to drive the implementation of the department’s business strategy to build the customer base and increase revenue business.
Manage the risk profile of the department's portfolio by contributing to customer pipelining/account planning discussions to select financially healthy customers.
Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and limits.
Develop and lead departmental initiatives to deliver increase revenue opportunities and deliver a high quality
REQUIREMENTS
Excellent business promotion, strategic thinking, creating sales strategy, covering FI + LC + GSB
Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence others and sell products.
Strong stakeholder management skills to collaborate with other departments.
Strong coaching, mentoring and leadership skills to manage a team.
In-depth knowledge of MUFG’s products and services.
In-depth knowledge in corporate finance and corporate credit analysis.
Strong understanding of the regional banking regulatory environment with particular focus on the local regulations.
If you are interested, please kindly contact Mr. Vu Vinh. Email: nghi.vu@employmentvietnam.com, Tel: 0987786544 for further details.

Communication - Actively listens and uses appropriate communication styles to deliver complex information in a clear concise way and influences others to accept a point of view, gain consensus, or take action.
Problem Solving and Decision Making - Models and sets expectations for solving complex problems, collecting and comparing information to evaluate alternatives, considering their potential impact before making decisions, involving others to gain agreement and support, and guiding others to implement solutions.

Driving for Results - Focuses and guides others in accomplishing work objectives.

Customer Relationships - Develops and sustains relationships based on an understanding of customer needs and actions consistent with the company’s service standards.
Global Mindset - Supports employees and business partners with diverse styles, abilities, motivations, and/or cultural perspectives; utilizes differences to drive innovation, engagement and enhance business results; and ensures employees are given the opportunity to contribute to their full potential.
Generating Talent and Organizational Capability

Organizational Capability - Evaluates and adapts the structure of organizational units, jobs, and work processes to best fit the needs and/or support the goals of an organizational unit.
Talent Management - Provides guidance and feedback to help individuals develop and strengthen skills and abilities needed to accomplish work objectives.
Learning and Applying Personal Expertise

Applied Learning - Seeks and makes the most of learning opportunities to improve performance of self and/or others.
Business Acumen - Understands and utilizes business information (e.g., data related to employee engagement, guest satisfaction, and property financial performance) to manage everyday operations and generate innovative solutions to approach business and administrative challenges.
Technical Acumen - Understands and utilizes professional skills and knowledge in a specific functional area to conduct and manage everyday business operations and generate innovative solutions to approach function-specific work challenges.
o Revenue Management - Knowledge of revenue management concepts, processes and strategies such as average daily rate, revenue per available room, sales cycles and trends, account management, pricing and inventory management. Skill in using a Yield Management system and interpreting pricing and inventory reports.

o Analysis - The ability to analyze and summarize detailed data to make inferences and recommendations. Included is the creation and maintenance of spreadsheets for storing data.

o Research - Skill in collecting information from a variety of sources relating to market data, historical cycles, travel and tourism trends, and real estate market dynamics. The ability to know when to seek addition information and where to look to find it.

o Inventory Management - The ability to manage rooms and function space restrictions and thresholds using systems or manually in order to maximize revenue/profit across all segments.

o Computer Skills - The willingness to learn and ability to use computer systems and software packages to input, access, modify, store, or output information or to execute programs and analyses. This includes the ability to enter and retrieve data from computer systems using a keyboard, mouse, or trackball.

o Economics and Finance - Knowledge of economic principles and practices, P&L statements, operating budgets, forecasting and scheduling, and the reporting of financial data.

o Sales and Marketing - Knowledge of sales and marketing concepts including principles and methods for showing, promoting and selling products or services as well as marketing strategies and tactics.

Basic Competencies - Fundamental competencies required for accomplishing basic work activities.
o Basic Computer Skills - Uses basic computer hardware and software (e.g., personal computers, word processing software, Internet browsers, etc.).

o Mathematical Reasoning - Demonstrates ability to add, subtract, multiply, or divide quickly, correctly, and in a way that allows one to solve work-related issues.

o Oral Comprehension - Demonstrates ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.

o Reading Comprehension - Demonstrates understanding of written sentences and paragraphs in work-related documents.

o Writing - Communicates effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.

description:
JOB RESPONSIBILITY
Purpose of the Role:
Primary responsibility to formulate and lead/execute business strategy for the Vietnam market (under
GCIB APAC’s strategic framework) to originate both non-financing flow transactions and financing
transactions (including lending, capital markets and/or project financing) for the entire GC Vietnam
portfolio. To provide leadership to the GC Vietnam team in terms of good corporate governance, strong
risk management (credit/market/operational risks) and objective personnel performance management.
To provide guidance to team members in the GC Vietnam team to promote a range of MUFG entities’
products and services to customers in Vietnam and the APAC region. Responsible for assessing all GC
customers’ complex credit and industry risks and support the GC team in deal structuring to mitigate
such risks for the Bank. Also responsible for reviewing all credit applications for deals within the team to
ensure pricing, product offerings and the structuring of the deal is aligned to business strategy coupled
with a strong focus on high service level for the clients.
Primary Responsibilities
Strategic
Develop and drive the GC Vietnam’s business plan, including originating new revenues and/or new customer on-boarding with GCIB APAC framework.
Building a sustainable business model, revenue streams and customer base in align to the bank’s direction/vision.
Understand the competitive landscape to review and reshape the department’s structure/operations to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Develop marketing strategies, action plans, and business promotion campaign to increase the bank’s revenues, cross-selling ratio and wallet/market share.
Lead and support the RM team to proactively develop customer relationship, anticipate/ manage customer’s expectation and provide effective solutions to achieve highest level of customer’s satisfaction.
Financial
Responsible to meet all of GC Vietnam’s BSC KPI targets (incl. financial targets and management targets, such deposit funding ratio or cross-selling ratio) by GCIB APAC and fulfil Bank management’s expectations in driving the bank’s initiatives/ campaigns/projects.
Responsible to track progress and results.
Customer
Ensure effective internal and external communication, ie within department and inter-department, plus externally with customers and/or external stakeholders.
Oversee the entire credit assessment of the department including bank facilities applications, review & renewals, timely monitoring and other relevant evaluation processes.
Ensure timely delivery and accuracy of banking facilities, credit assessment, analysis and evaluation.
Establish effective collaboration with product offices, regional HQ, overseas office in conducting business promotion & cross-selling.
Supervise the negotiation process between deal team members and customers to achieve highest level of efficiency, effectiveness and customer’s satisfaction.
Lead and support team to build long-term banking relationships with key customers to develop new business and to deliver extraordinary customer experiences.
Anticipate as well as be sensitive to shifting customer expectations and guide the team to consider appropriate measures to ensure the Bank stays ahead of competitors.
Develop and maintain strong stakeholder management with key stakeholders both within MUFG and externally.
Work in partnership with colleagues within the branch to deliver an integrated service for our customers, as well as to share knowledge and best practices on own area of expertise.
Work in partnership with other GCIB relationship managers across our global network for large cross border deals to understand the customer’s business strategy, financial needs, product proposals and provide input to key customer sales pitches.
Work in partnership with colleagues in Head Office and Regional Office to discuss complex deals and seek commercial solutions for the customer.
Work in partnership with Credit on any credit issues associated with the deal.
Work in partnership with Product Offices from MUFG and MUFG entities including but not limited to Vietin Bank (and Morgan Stanley) to leverage our network capabilities and products/expertise for deals as well as to maintain relationship for future business opportunities.
Visit clients as often as required, to represent the Bank to resolve issues and to maintain customer relationships.
People
Responsible for managing (objective setting & performance management), developing (coaching, career progression & training) and rewarding (financial and non-financial reward decisions) for Direct Reports.
Act as a role model to team members and adhere to all company policies / guidelines.
Support, coach and guide team on complex Corporate Banking issues.
Provide appropriate guidance and advise to subordinate in terms of work, business and career advancement.
Support, coach and guide the team on complex GCIB issues.
Other/Control
Support team by leading the meeting or presentation to senior level customers.
Review all deal proposals and credit applications if necessary to ensure pricing, product offerings and the structuring of the deal is aligned to business strategy, delivers a high quality of service to customers and mitigates risk for the Bank.
Review presentation materials for pitches prepared by the team and provide input.
Support team by leading difficult negotiations with customers including but not limited to contract terms and conditions and pricing, as well as seek commercial solutions to finalise the deal.
Lead and support initiatives to drive the implementation of the department’s business strategy to build the customer base and increase revenue business.
Manage the risk profile of the department's portfolio by contributing to customer pipelining/account planning discussions to select financially healthy customers.
Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and limits.
Develop and lead departmental initiatives to deliver increase revenue opportunities and deliver a high quality of service to customers.
Participate in relevant committees regionally as well as globally.
Maintain good working knowledge of industry trends, products, relevant laws and regulations.
Act as a Subject Matter Expert on corporate banking to management.
REQUIREMENT
Excellent business promotion, strategic thinking, creating sales strategy, covering FI + LC + GSB
Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence others and sell products.
Strong stakeholder management skills to collaborate with other departments.
Strong coaching, mentoring and leadership skills to manage a team.
In-depth knowledge of MUFG’s products and services.
In-depth knowledge in corporate finance and corporate credit analysis.
Strong understanding of the regional banking regulatory environment with particular focus on the local regulations.

description:
OUR HIRING PROCESS:
We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals—every person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSEmedia team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.

Are you passionate about marketing? Ready to dive into the world of demand generation? INFUSEmedia is one of the fastest growing lead generation companies! INFUSED with drive, innovation, and integrity,
we craft demand solutions with precision to fuel our clients' pipelines, every time.
We are always looking for bright, motivated people to join our team. Apply now and tap into INFUSEmedia's growth!

Job Requirement
